The thing with Dragon Trainer Heimer is that it was an extremely popular, creative, and long awaited skin concept. While Dragon Trainer Kled would have been nice, I feel like there are more creative options on the table that they could have went with for him. For example, I have my own concept for a Dullahan Kled skin, my favorite part of which is the fact that his Q is his head on a rope.

I mean, I'm not sure why people are so ungrateful just because its a "joke skin". Sir Kled rides a Chocobo FFS, and you draw the line at an adorable, fluffy bat? I think it's cute, funny, and creative, and I'd rather have this than another darker, edgier skin(which I'm sure people would complain about too). I feel like they could've gone with a different color, but the overall concept for the skin is nice. Just be glad he got a skin at all, because honestly, it could be worse.

Yeah, I admit, I'm disappointed that Heimer got the cool Dragon Trainer skin and not Kled. :( How fucking cool would Dragon Trainer Kled be? He'd *literally* be riding a dragon. A cowardly, kind of derpy dragon but *a fucking dragon!* But instead they gave it to Heimer... which is disappointing.

Wouldn't that be kind of redundant, though? I mean, Skaarl's already _very_ reptilian. If they made him a dragon, they would either make him too similar to how he normally looks, or (too avoid the previous option) make him look too different.

I'd agree except they've been releasing the same Ahri skin for almost three years now. Star Guardian is just Pop Star Ahri and Academy Ahri had a baby. And the new skin is just American Pop Star Ahri. .-. Riot is clearly not a noob to redundancy; they do plenty of it. Arguably, the last Tristana skin they released(Omega Squad) was just Guerilla and Rocket Girl mashed together; pretty darn redundant. 

And for that matter, making Skaarl look too different doesn't seem to be a huge issue to me. They turned him into a bat for this skin. Why is it an issue for Skaarl to look too different but not for Tristana's gun to look super different or Heimer's turrets be super different?

To answer your first point, when a champion has a lot of skins, it becomes harder to avoid redundancy since the ideas they had off the top of their heads have all been expended. Kled is an open door for loads of crazy possibilities; they're not gonna go for something so easy when they could end up accidentally putting too little effort (because it's easy) or too much effort (to counteract the former possibility).

To answer your second point, I think that's a very dangerous precedent to set. Riot does its best to preserve the character and demeanor of a champion in a skin. If they made Skaarl look too different, we might end up loosing that. Skaarl is this derpy, cowardly lizard that runs at the first sign of danger. They need to makes sure they keep that as a constant between his base and his other skins. As for your point about Tristana's gun and Heimer's turrets, those aren't part of the base model. Skaarl is. If you make him look too different, loads of problems could arise. Look at Blitz's Lancer skins, so to make sure players recognized him, they made him walk like and idiot. Do you really want the same thing to happen to Kled?
